alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 26 at 4:45PM CDT until October 28 at 2:38AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Fayette. * WHEN...Until 745 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 445 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Schulenburg, Fayetteville, Round Top, Mullins Prairie, Holman, Rutersville, Ellinger, Ammannsville, Dubina, Swiss Alp, Rek Hill, Warrenton, High Hill, Freyburg and Winedale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
